Posts.Content: If secondary's start, with so many side effects from the Letrozole.  You can't feel any lumps in the chest area or under the arm.  It frightens me
Posts.Title: How are you supposed to know

Posts.Content: i had underarm clearance of lymph nodes five weeks ago.  Iv noticed a swelling on my arm half way down on the flat part of my arm.  I have some restriction of my arm but not too bad.  I'm using it only stretching is difficult its early days I suppose, I just want to get back my fitness, before Radiotherapy and Letrozole starts
Posts.Title: Lump in the arm

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for both answers swinging the affected arm is working. I have fairly good mobility in the arm but pain and the swelling.  I will contact my BCN in a week or so I'll try the extra excerizes first.  Thank you both TC xx
Posts.Title: Lump in the arm

Posts.Content: Hi posh quitter iv nothing to add to this post except to say you will get through this with the attitude you have you are a strong woman TC
Posts.Title: Hello, I have just joined this group.

Posts.Content: I'm glad to see this question and answer as I will be taking Letrozole with in the next few weeks.  I'm Hungery for any info!
Posts.Title: Anastrozolum

Posts.Content: So glad you are feeling a lot better. TCx
Posts.Title: What a difference 7 days make

Posts.Content: I have burning and drawing, hot painful sessions throughout the day. I am three months post radiotherapy.
Posts.Title: Burning pains

Posts.Content: I totally agree I was fuming the guit you carry with you as well as being told its your own fault NOWAY
Posts.Title: Cancer is our own fault

Posts.Content: I agree with you Lee.  We have all felt the guilt and thought maybe if I didn't stand by the microwave every evening when warming my night cap (milk)  but, to broadcast it on the news it's our fault we got the big C .  I felt bullied ,does that mean my family are more at risk because we have the same diet day in day out ?.  I am a normal weight I have never smoked I hardly drink alcohol.  Pointing the finger does nothing!
Posts.Title: Cancer is our own fault
